greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation t->t-1 of Z, folded to N.
comment: This permutation consists of just one cycle, which is infinite.
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: Let f: Z -> N be given by f(z) = 2z if z>0 else 2|z|+1, with inverse g(z) = z/2 if z even else (1-z)/2. Then a(n) = f(g(n)-1).
xref: Obtained by composing permutations A065190 and A014681.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 19 2001
